photosearcher 1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Search for photo metadata

Source: R/photo_search.R
photo_search.Rd

Returns image metadata for photos matching the search terms.

photo_search(mindate = "2019-01-01", maxdate = "2019-01-01",
  text = NULL, tags = NULL, bbox = NULL, has_geo = TRUE)

Arguments

mindate

character. Minimum date of photograph for search provided as "YYYY-MM-DD".
maxdate

character. Maximum date of photograph for search provided as "YYYY-MM-DD".
text

character. Optional text to be searched.
tags

character. Optional tags to filter by.
bbox

character. Optional bounding box of search area provide as: minimum_longitude, minimum_latitude, maximum_longitude, maximum_latitude.
has_geo

logical. Optional arguement for whether returned photos need to be georeference.

Value

data.frame. Output consists of 57 variables including; latitude and longitude of photograph, date and time it was taken, associated tags and image urls.

Full list of variables returned: id, owner, secret, server, farm, title, ispublic, isfriend, isfamily, license, datetaken, datetakengranularity, datetakenunknown, count_views, count_comments, count_faves, tags, latitude, longitude, accuracy, context, place_id, woeid, geo_is_family, geo_is_friend, geo_is_contact, geo_is_public, url_sq, height_sq, width_sq, url_t, height_t, width_t, url_s, height_s, width_s url_q, height_q, width_q, url_m, height_m, width_m, url_n, height_n, width_n, url_z, height_z, width_z, url_c, height_c, width_c, url_l, height_l, width_l, url_o, height_o, width_o.

Details

Uses the flickr.photos.search API method from the Flickr API. This search method requires a limiting factor to prevent parameterless searches - to enure this is met the function requires both a minimum and a maximum date that searched photographs were taken on. See https://www.flickr.com/services/api/flickr.photos.search.html for more information on the API method.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
photo_search(
  mindate = "2019-01-01",
  maxdate = "2019-01-02",
  text = "tree",
  bbox = "-13.623047,47.279229,3.251953,60.630102",
  has_geo = TRUE
)


photo_search(
  mindate = "2019-01-01",
  maxdate = "2019-01-02",
  text = "tree",
  bbox = "-13.623047,47.279229,3.251953,60.630102",
  has_geo = TRUE
)
# }
